intro: Placolobium, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hard, woody structure, which contributes to its durability. Placolobium species are often used in traditional medicine and for their strong, dense wood. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
